alert.note: Alert for Dade (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 10:37PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Catoosa, northwestern Walker and Dade Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1037 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Signal Mountain to near Stephensville to near Fabius, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Ringgold, Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, Lookout Mountain, Chattanooga Valley, Rising Fawn, Lakeview, Indian Springs, Graysville, Blue Spring, Cole City, Wildwood, Fairview, Stephensville, Boynton, Beaumont, Chattanooga Valley, New England and Morganville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for northwestern Georgia.
